meanings.definition: The quality of being unwilling to change or compromise.
meanings.sent1: Her inflexibleness in sticking to her principles impressed everyone.
meanings.sent2: His inflexibleness in negotiations made it difficult to reach a compromise.
meanings.sent3: Despite his inflexibleness, he managed to find a creative solution to the problem.
meanings.sent4: The inflexibleness of the old oak tree symbolized strength and resilience.
meanings.sent5: The inflexibleness of the rules made it hard for any exceptions to be made.

meanings.definition: The state of being rigid or unyielding.
meanings.sent1: The inflexibleness of the metal rod made it impossible to bend.
meanings.sent2: The inflexibleness of the frozen ground made it hard to dig.
meanings.sent3: The inflexibleness of the ruler's posture during the meeting was comical.
meanings.sent4: The inflexibleness of the mountain range seemed to defy any attempts to conquer it.
meanings.sent5: The inflexibleness of the wall made it clear it would not yield to any force.
